rules: Rule1: Provided that a chef prepares a food, then if that food is served to a customer, the customer becomes satisfied.
Rule2: Under the condition that an ingredient is fresh, then a chef cooks a food.
Rule3: Whenever an ingredient is stored, then a chef prepares a food.
Rule4: If a supplier delivers an ingredient, then that ingredient is fresh.
Rule5: In the event that a manager purchases an ingredient, then that ingredient is stored.
Rule6: Either an ingredient is expired, or a supplier delivers an ingredient, or a manager purchases an ingredient.
Rule7: An ingredient is spoiled, or if it is not the case that a table is available or reserved, then the table is not occupied.
Rule8: Should a manager check an ingredient, then it is not the case that the ingredient is spoiled.
Rule9: Provided that a chef inspects an ingredient, then a manager checks that ingredient.
Rule10: If an inspector finds a problem, then whenever it is not the case that an ingredient is contaminated or a chef inspects an ingredient, the ingredient is discarded.
Rule11: An inspector finds a problem or staff reports a problem.
Rule12: In the event that staff reports a problem, then if it is not the case that an ingredient is contaminated or a chef inspects an ingredient, the ingredient is discarded.
Rule13: Should a table be clean, then a cleaner wipes that table.
Rule14: Whenever a cleaner wipes a table, then the table is sanitized.
Rule15: Provided that a table is sanitized, then it is ready.
Rule16: In the event that a cleaner arrives at work, then the cleaner is scheduled for a shift.
Rule17: Either a cleaner arrives at work or a manager calls a cleaner.
Rule18: Should a manager call a cleaner, then if it is not the case that a ready table implies it is available or reserved, the table is dirty.
Rule19: Under the condition that a table is wood, then it is available.
Rule20: Provided that a table is metal, then it is reserved.
Rule21: A table is polished or a table is repaired.
Rule22: Whenever a table is repaired, then it is metal.
Rule23: Should a table be maintained, then it is varnished.
Rule24: Either a table is maintained or a table is serviced.
Rule25: Provided that a table is serviced, then if it is polished, it is wood.
Rule26: If a table is varnished, then it is finished.
Rule27: Should a table be finished, then it is protected.
Rule28: In the event that a table is protected, then if it is polished, it is wood.
Rule29: Provided that a table is available, then a customer sits at that table.
Rule30: If a chair is broken, then whenever it is not the case that a table is available or reserved, the table is not occupied.
Rule31: Under the condition that a table is damaged, then if it is not the case that a table is available or reserved, the table is not occupied.
Rule32: Furniture is unsafe, or a chair is broken, or a table is damaged.
Rule33: Should a manager replace furniture, then it is not the case that the furniture is unsafe.
Rule34: Provided that a manager orders furniture, then the manager replaces furniture.
Rule35: If an ingredient is local, then it is fresh or stored.
Rule36: Either an ingredient is local or an ingredient is imported.

Rule37: In the event that a manager budgets a cost, then if it is not the case that the absence of an imported ingredient implying it is fresh or stored leads to the ingredient not being expensive, the ingredient is affordable.
Rule38: A manager budgets a cost or an owner approves a cost.
Rule39: Should a table be reserved, then if a customer pays a bill, the customer does not order a food.

Rule40: Under the condition that an owner approves a cost, then if it is not the case that the absence of an imported ingredient implying it is fresh or stored leads to the ingredient not being expensive, the ingredient is affordable.
Rule41: If a chef cooks a food, then whenever that food is served to a customer, the customer becomes satisfied.
Rule42: Provided that it is not the case that an ingredient is contaminated or a chef inspects an ingredient, then it is not the case that the ingredient is discarded.
Rule43: Under the condition that it is not the case that a table is available or reserved, then the table is occupied.
Rule44: If it is not the case that an imported ingredient implies it is fresh or stored, then the ingredient is expensive.
Rule45: Whenever it is not the case that the absence of a table being available or reserved leads to the table not being occupied, then a waiter is assigned to the table.
Rule46: Should it not be the case that the absence of a table being available or reserved leads to the table not being occupied, then it is not the case that a waiter is assigned to the table.

Rule47: In the event that it is not the case that the absence of an imported ingredient implying it is fresh or stored leads to the ingredient not being expensive, then it is not the case that the ingredient is affordable.
Rule48: Provided that a customer is not satisfied, then the customer orders a food.
Rule49: Should a customer not be satisfied, then the customer pays a bill.
facts: Fact3: A food is served to a customer.
Fact4: It is not the case that an ingredient is expired.
Fact5: It is not the case that an ingredient is contaminated.
Fact6: It is not the case that a table is dirty.
Fact7: It is not the case that a cleaner is scheduled for a shift.
Fact8: It is not the case that a customer sits at a table.
